DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the clinical outcomes and the operative costs of appendectomy performed with the Hem-O-Lok polymetric clips compared to endoscopic staplers. Prospective data will be collected before, during, and after surgery on patients undergoing a laparoscopic appendectomy that have the Hem-o-Lok ® stapler used to close the stump after the appendix is removed. Use of the Hem-o-Lok ® stapler is standard for appendectomy patients at Duke Regional Hospital. Retrospective data will be collected from patients who had an appendectomy prior to 1/2012 using a different clip as part of their surgery, or an open appendectomy to compare outcomes.
DOC.brief_title: Comparative Study of Polymetric Clips (Hem-o-Lok) Versus Historical Endoscopic Staplers for Laparoscopic Appendectomy
DOC.criteria: 1. 18 years of age or older 2. scheduled to undergo a laparoscopic appendectomy because of a diagnosis of appendicitis based on clinical history or radiographic imaging. 1. Less than 18 years of age 2. Signs of appendiceal rupture or abcess on preoperative imaging studies (CT or ultrasound) 3. Inability to provide informed consent
